data.title: The Cher Show — OGUNQUIT PLAYHOUSE
data.text:
Sara is thrilled to return to Ogunquit, having played the Cher role of Alexandra in The Witches of Eastwick (2014). Broadway/First National Tours: The Addams Family (Morticia), A Free Man of Color (Dona Athene opposite Jeffrey Wright and MOS DEF), 101 Dalmatians (Cruella DeVille), Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (Jolene opposite John Lithgow), Nine (Carla opposite Antonio Banderas and John Stamos), The Boys From Syracuse, Seussical, Fosse. NYC: Atomic, Carnival, Chicago, Grey Gardens, Anything Goes, Catch Me If You Can, Pippin. TV/Film: Without a Trace, Guiding Light (CBS); Law & Order, Ed (NBC); The Big C (Showtime), Forbidden Love, Georgetown, Sex and the City: The Movie. In addition to numerous Broadway and Original Cast Recordings, Sara was also a member of the classical-crossover trio Three Graces whose self-titled album debuted on Billboard’s Top 10 list.

David is delighted to return to the beautiful Ogunquit Playhouse after appearing as Gomez in The Addams Family and Harry in Mamma Mia! Broadway: La Cage aux Folles, Seussical: The Musical, Putting it Together with Carol Burnett, Forever Plaid, Plaid Tidings; plus Forever Plaid: The Movie. Career Favorites: Crazy for You, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, The Producers, The Music Man, The Full Monty, Kiss Me Kate, Hairspray, Art, Elf, Six Dance Lessons in Six Weeks opposite the legendary Leslie Caron. David was also paired romantically with RuPaul in the award-winning cult film musical, Zombie Prom. Mr. Engel is a six-time recipient of the LA Stage Alliance Ovation Award, and the relatively good-natured loser of many others!

Rick’s first Broadway credit, Jersey Boys, co-authored with Marshall Brickman, won the Tony Award, the Grammy Award, and the Olivier Award for Best Musical, and is in the record books as the twelfth longest-running show in Broadway history. With Marshall Brickman and Andrew Lippa, he wrote The Addams Family, starring Nathan Lane and Bebe Neuwirth. For the past five years, The Addams Family has been the number one or number two most licensed musical in North America. His first play, Peter and the Starcatcher, directed by Roger Rees and Alex Timbers, received more Tony Award nominations than any American play in Broadway history, winning five in 2012. For the past six years, Peter and the Starcatcher has consistently been in the top five most produced plays in North America. Rick also wrote the double Tony Award-winning The Cher Show for Broadway, directed by Jason Moore; the world premiere of a new musical, My Very Own British Invasion, at Paper Mill Playhouse directed by Jerry Mitchell; the world premiere of a new musical, Dog and Pony, at The Old Globe with music and lyrics by Michael Patrick Walker; and the world premiere of a new musical, Turn of the Century, co-authored with Marshall Brickman and directed by Tommy Tune. Current projects include The Princess Bride for Disney, and Smash for Robert Greenblatt, Neil Meron, and Steven Spielberg with Bob Martin; Monopoly, for Hasbro, with David Rossmer and Dan Lipton; and Mad Season, with Rob Thomas, Matt Serletic, and Matt Walden of Matchbox Twenty, directed by Schele Williams. Rick is also adapting Sara Gruen’s popular novel Water for Elephants with the acclaimed theater collective, Pig Pen, directed by Jessica Stone; and writing an entirely original musical (!) based on the rivalry between Darwin and Roget, love, death, madness and the creation of Roget’s Thesaurus, with 2021 Ed Kleban Award winner, Benjamin Scheuer. Rick’s book, Finding Roger, An Improbably Theatrical Love Story, a tribute to his late husband, Roger Rees, is published by Kingswell.

In addition to being the choreographer for the hit Off-Broadway show Spamilton, Gerry won widespread acclaim for choreographing Godspell, the first Equity-approved show staged during COVID at the Berkshire Theatre Group. He is Associate Artistic Director of the York Theatre where he directed Hallelujah Baby and choreographed Anything Can Happen In The Theatre and Forbidden Broadway: The Next Generation. OP: Chicago. Broadway: The Wiz. Regional: Memphis (Gateway Playhouse), The Wizard of Oz (Pittsburg CLO), Kinky Boots (The Hangar Theater), Once On This Island (Martin Beck Theatre, Virginia Stage, Pioneer Theatre, Actors’ Theatre Of Louisville, La Mirada Theatre), Ain't Misbehavin (Great Lakes Theatre, Actors Theatre Of Louisville, Pioneer Theatre, Theatre by The Sea), Joseph (Lyric Theatre). Nat’l Tours: Dreamgirls, Nina Simone Four Women, Oklahoma, A Chorus Line, Side by Side, Tommy, My Fair Lady, A Saint She Ain’t. As a performer, Gerry was in the original company of Once On this Island, Anything Goes (with Patti Lupone), and was one of the three Americans cast in the tour of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat with Donny Osmond. gerrymcintyre.net

Andy has designed many Broadway and West End Theater musicals including Blood Brothers and Buddy: The Buddy Holly Story. When Buddy opened, Andy was 21, the youngest designer ever to work in the West End. Buddy ran in London for 13 years and soon became an international hit with 22 versions worldwide. When the show opened in New York, Andy became the youngest designer ever to work on Broadway. He has designed two of the longest-running musicals in West End history and the biggest shows in the history of television including American Idol, So You Think You Can Dance, America's Got Talent, and Who Wants To Be a Millionaire in 108 countries making it the most duplicated scenic design in history. Andy’s American Idol set design has appeared in the States and internationally in over 50 countries receiving three Emmy nominations and a win for Outstanding Art Direction. andywalmsley.com

Costume and fashion designer Bob Mackie is a nine-time Emmy Award winner, Geoffrey Beene CFDA Lifetime Achievement Award recipient and has three Oscar nominations. Most recently, he received a 2019 Tony, Drama Desk, and Outer Critics Circle Award for his designs for The Cher Show. His Broadway credits include Moon Over Buffalo and Putting It Together, both starring Carol Burnett; Best Little Whorehouse Goes Public; Minnelli on Minnelli; Lorelei starring Carol Channing; and On the Town with Bernadette Peters and Phyllis Newman. Broadway on Television: Once Upon a Mattress starring Carol Burnett, Gypsy starring Bette Midler, Carousel, Brigadoon, Of Thee I Sing, and Kismet. His inventive and memorable designs have helped raise entertainers such as Tina Turner, Diana Ross, Cher, Elton John, Ann-Margret, Bernadette Peters, Mitzi Gaynor, Carol Burnett, Bette Midler, Pink, and Cher to iconic status both onscreen and off.

Kevin is delighted to be returning to the Playhouse for his ninth season. OP Favorites: Ragtime, Mystic Pizza, Young Frankenstein, Cabaret, Kinky Boots, Jersey Boys, An American in Paris, From Here to Eternity, Mamma Mia, The Hunchback of Notre Dame, Million Dollar Quartet. Broadway (as Assoc Sound Designer): The Minutes, All The Way, The Cherry Orchard, The Country House. Off-Broadway: ¡Americano!, Neal Brennan’s Unacceptable, #DateMe, Einstein’s Dreams, The Hello Girls, In & Of Itself, Midnight at The Never Get. Along with dozens of productions at Regional theaters across the country, Kevin has designed the sound for the International Premieres of Fun Home (starring Lea Salonga), Kinky Boots, and Matilda in Manila, Philippines. Kevin is also an independent producer and general manager who works frequently with BenDeLaCreme Presents and recently produced his first feature film with The Jinkx and DeLa Holiday Special, now streaming on Hulu. @thekevinheard

has returned to Ogunquit Playhouse for her 15th season. After taking over as Resident Scenic Charge 12 years ago, she has designed several Sets for our Arts Academy Program, as well as adding her artistic eye to many of mainstage productions. Since falling in love with Ogunquit Playhouse, Cheryl, and her husband Geof Dolan (OP Technical Director) have made the Seacoast their home year-round. Cheryl considers the Playhouse staff her family and hopes her love and passion for theatre is translated through these productions to all of you.

A full-service theatrical licensing partner specializing in the development, production, and worldwide distribution of new and established theatrical properties. Approaching the licensing universe with a wholly personal and produceorial vision, the company partners with authors, agents, and producers to harness the power derived from embracing the intersection of art and commerce. Broadway Licensing advocates for the author, committing to have as many people experience their work as possible, while protecting the copyright, utilizing its pioneering digital platform, high touch servicing, and cutting-edge strategies to execute that vision. As a trusted curator of important, daring, and entertaining theatre, with a dedication to diversity and inclusion, Broadway Licensing helps build experiences that are bigger than itself; where communities come together to share the ideas of an author’s work, inspiring conversations, and forging memories that last a lifetime.
